post.text: FBI Director Comey—who released a vague and misleading letter about Hillary's emails just days before the election—opposed releasing details about Russian interference because he thought it was too close to the election. Incredible.

comment.author: Caroline
comment.text: I am not even a Hillary supporter and think this is trash. How Comey handled these new emails is dishonest and raises questions about him, not her. The FBI isn't supposed to try to influence elections.

replies.author: Georgette
replies.text: If she didn't want the FBI involved she wouldn't have lied, plead the fifth, and deleted 30,000+ emails. There's no one to blame but Hillary.

replies.author: Caroline
replies.text: Georgette Republicans criticized the timing of the Trump sexual assault and groping allegations. It is fair to do the same with this, since the Bureau advised Comey against releasing the vague letter he wrote to Congress 11 days before the election. These emails haven't even been reviewed, this could have waited. Who is to say that these are duplicates of already reviewed emails? It's clearly an attempt to meddle with the election and he should be fired regardless of the investigations outcome.

replies.author: Georgette
replies.text: Caroline is it? Because they just got a search warrant for huma's property and data. Which means there's probable cause at a minimuk

replies.author: Caroline
replies.text: Georgette how would they know if they haven't reviewed them? The only "probable cause" I know of is because of the summer investigation. Better yet, why would Anthony Wiener be privy to national security secrets, I highly doubt that he has been read into classified programs. I don't think this round is as big of a deal as people want to make it.
